sentences.sContent: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.sCn: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.sContent: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.sCn: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

sentences.sContent: ...The spread of no-fault divorce has reduced the bargaining power of whichever spouse is more interested in continuing the relationship...
...Some people may long for an era when divorce was still hard to come by...
...lifelong marriages can be promoted by practices such as the cultural prohibition of divorce and arranged marriages that are seen as a contract between two families...
...the divorce rate had declined by around 25% from 1929 But this doesn’t mean people were suddenly happier with their marriages...
...we may see a drop in our sky high divorce rate...
...The divorce rate rose again during the rest of the decade as the recovery took hold...
...What's less clear is whether divorce and separation rates rise in a recession – financial pressures mean couples argue more but make splitting up less affordable...

trans.tranCn: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
trans.tranOther: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage
